private_information: Familiar with the available action schemata: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted and their parameter arities.
Knows preconditions and effects at a symbolic level as described in the public information but does not assume any hidden facts.
Has access to the two provided statement blocks and the two candidate plans and can reason about applied action instances.
planner_agent.goal: Analyze the provided action sequence plans for causal precondition satisfaction and produce a compact causal link list and unmet-precondition spots for each plan step.

private_information: Can perform forward simulation of symbolic facts given action preconditions and effects.
Will not emit a final PDDL file but will produce stepwise state traces and highlight state changes relevant to goal atoms.
simulator_agent.goal: Simulate the candidate plans from the initial conditions and report the state after each action, flagging any action whose preconditions are violated.

private_information: Expert in temporal and causal consistency checking across multi-step plans.
Specifically tasked to remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, and other non-physical bookkeeping shortcuts present in plans.
Will normalize any bookkeeping artifacts into explicit causal steps or mark them as invalid if they cannot be justified by available actions and facts.
auditor.goal: Audit the plan traces and causal analyses, remove or replace bookkeeping shortcuts, and produce a corrected causal/temporal artifact report suitable for formalization into PDDL.

private_information: Receives analysis, simulation traces, and audit reports from the other agents and must integrate them.

Will produce a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver. The generated PDDL must keep agent actions distinct where relevant and be compatible with classical STRIPS-style features supported by FastDownwards.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate inputs from planner_agent, simulator_agent, and auditor to produce a final PDDL domain and problem file for FastDownwards that encodes the task and corrected initial/goal states.

public_information: Objects in the world are named object_0 through object_14. Actions available: paltry(obj0,obj1,obj2), sip(obj0,obj1,obj2), clip(obj0,obj1,obj2), wretched(obj0,obj1,obj2,obj3), memory(obj0,obj1,obj2), tightfisted(obj0,obj1,obj2).
Action preconditions and effects summary: To perform paltry need hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, vase obj0 obj1, next obj1 obj2. Paltry makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes vase obj0 obj1 false.
For sip need hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, next obj0 obj2, next obj1 obj2. Sip makes vase obj0 obj1 true and makes next obj0 obj2 false.
For clip need hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2, next obj0 obj2. Clip makes vase obj0 obj1 true and makes next obj0 obj2 false.
For wretched need sneeze obj0, texture obj1, texture obj2, stupendous obj3, next obj0 obj1, collect obj1 obj3, collect obj2 obj3. Wretched makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes next obj0 obj1 false.
For memory need cats obj0, spring obj1, spring obj2, next obj0 obj1. Memory makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes next obj0 obj1 false.
For tightfisted need hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2, vase obj0 obj1. Tightfisted makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes vase obj0 obj1 false.

Initial statement block A: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, hand object_14, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_10, next object_12 object_5, next object_13 object_7, next object_14 object_9, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_9, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Goal A: next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_8, next object_13 object_5, next object_14 object_7.

Candidate plan A provided by the user is a list of 20 action instances including clip, wretched, tightfisted, sip, memory, paltry applied to specific object tuples. The plans may include bookkeeping shortcuts and transient tokens.

Initial statement block B: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, hand object_14, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_6, next object_12 object_8, next object_13 object_6, next object_14 object_5, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_10, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Goal B: next object_11 object_10, next object_12 object_6, next object_13 object_10, next object_14 object_7.
User provided two candidate plans corresponding to the two statement blocks; both plans are available to the agents for analysis and simulation.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a domain analyst. Do not emit PDDL. Your task is to read the public information about action schemata, initial facts, goals, and the candidate plans. Produce for each plan a step-indexed list that records for each action instance the required preconditions, the effects applied, and any missing or ambiguous preconditions. Also produce a compact causal link list indicating which action establishes which precondition for which later action.
analysis.prompt: planner_agent has access to the environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Use that information to produce the requested step-indexed precondition/effect analysis and causal links for each provided candidate plan. If information is missing, mark it as unknown instead of making assumptions.

simulation.system_prompt: You are a forward symbolic simulator. Do not emit PDDL. Starting from each initial statement block, apply each action of the corresponding candidate plan in order if its preconditions are met. Produce a state trace after each action, list actions that were inapplicable due to missing preconditions, and track the truth value of goal atoms across the trace.
simulation.prompt: simulator_agent sees the same environment public information: {environment->public_information}. For each candidate plan, run a conservative symbolic forward simulation. Record the state after each step and indicate whether the action was applied, skipped, or failed due to unmet preconditions.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor of temporal and causal consistency. Do not emit PDDL. Your job is to reconcile the planner analysis and the simulator traces, identify bookkeeping shortcuts or post-hoc adjustments that the candidate plans rely on, and remove or replace them with explicit causal steps. Provide a corrected sequence of symbolic transformations or explain why a bookkeeping shortcut cannot be justified.
audit.prompt: auditor receives the planner analysis and simulation traces: {plan_analysis} and {simulation_trace}. Identify all bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, implicit resets, or non-causal post-hoc justifications. Replace each shortcut with a concrete sequence of actions or mark it as invalid. Produce an audit report that lists corrected causal sequences and a final normalized action sequence fragment for each identified artifact.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your role is to integrate the analysis, simulation traces, and the audit report and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem pair targeted to the FastDownwards solver. The PDDL must be classical STRIPS compatible, avoid temporal constructs not supported by FastDownwards, and keep actions distinct when they represent different agent views or roles. Enclose the domain text between <domain></domain> tags and the problem text between <problem></problem>. The domain should include action schemata consistent with the public action preconditions and effects after audit corrections. The problem should encode the corrected initial facts and the chosen goal atoms.
pddl.prompt: orchestrator must integrate the following artifacts: planner analysis {plan_analysis}, simulator traces {simulation_trace}, and audit findings {audit_report}. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem pair compatible with FastDownwards that encode the audited/corrected model. Keep distinct action names where necessary and annotate in comments which parts were derived from which agent input. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
